emails.subject: AeroDelft Intership Platform / General Collaboration
emails.body:
Dear Daniel,

We met last year at the AeroDelft Lustrum, I was supposed to reach out for
the internship platform. This is still mostly word of mouth and is due for
a real structure, but I've had to sideline it for a while. I want to work
on it over the summer when I have some time.

The other reason I want to reach out is to see what potential
collaboration there is. We often get referred to contact DLR when looking
for external advice and I think it is certainly beneficial for AeroDelft to
be able to expand the current network. Likewise, I feel DLR stands to gain
from this arrangement as well.

Best regards,
-- 

Emil Wes Lambert

Business Manager AeroDelft

emails.subject: Update on AeroDelft testing
emails.body:
Dear Charlotte,

I apologise for the lack of communication on our side. We have been
experiencing delays to testing due to a missing component, however, we have
found a suitable alternative for testing and will begin testing at the
end of this week / the coming week.

We wanted to integrate the air products post with the successful testing of
our gaseous hydrogen testbed (we thought this would be a great occasion to
demonstrate the partnership).

With regards to the liquid hydrogen post, we faced similar delays. We had a
test campaign back in December but had issues with the vacuum of the
cryogenic tank. This has now been resolved and we are waiting for a testing
slot at our facilities. We are expecting to begin testing in 2-4 weeks.
This will also make a great post as this will be the first time any student
team works with liquid hydrogen.

If you have time, I'd be happy to set up a call and give a quick update on
the project. Just let me know a time, Tuesday-Thursday is when I am most
free.

I will update you when I know/have more information on the testing.

Best regards,
-- 

Emil Wes Lambert

Business Manager AeroDelft

E: emil.lambert@aerodelft.nl

emails.subject: AeroDelft Follow up from our meeting
emails.body:
Dear Luciana & Arjan,

It was great meeting you last week; thank you for your time. I wanted to
follow up to schedule a more formal introduction.

I think it would be nice to begin with a tour of our part of the aircraft
hall, to show what we work on and our students who work on it. We also have
a short presentation we can do to show a bit of the history as well as our
testbed, which is currently being tested at one of our testing facilities.
This might also be a good time for you to introduce yourselves to the
others.

Let me know a good time that works, I suspect this will take about 1.5-2
hours.

Enjoy your weekend,
--

emails.subject: AeroDelft & Cryoworld, future steps in our partnership
emails.body:
Dear Gerrie & Marcel,

I hope youâre doing well. First, I want to express our gratitude for your
continued support, especially during the recent prototype testing campaign
with your LH2 dewar. Seeing your technology in action was a great moment
for the team and underscored the critical role Cryoworld plays in our
mission.

Weâd also like to acknowledge that there have been delays in communication,
and we regret any frustrations this may have caused. Your patience and
dedication to this partnership have not gone unnoticed, and weâre committed
to improving how we collaborate moving forward. Therefore, I'd like to
share our thoughts on how we see our partnership evolving.

Evolving Tank Sourcing Strategy

Over the past few months, weâve shifted toward a dual-source strategy. This
decision stems from our commitment to mitigating risks and safeguarding
timelines while also creating opportunities for exploration and learning.
Specifically, we aim to:

â¢ Mitigate Delays: Address any potential design or production challenges
swiftly.

â¢ Explore Materials: Broaden our understanding of cryogenic systems through
the use of multiple tank materials.

While this approach broadens our scope, Cryoworld will remain integral to
our cryogenic operations and AeroDelftâs sole tank partner. We are fully
committed to designing and manufacturing the tank with your team and
continuing our collaboration on the LH2 distribution system, testing
campaigns, and other critical cryogenic operations.

Cryoworldâs Role in the Project

Your contributions have been indispensable, and we want to emphasise
Cryoworldâs continued role at the core of our efforts. Having the Cryoworld
dewar on-site during the LH2 testing campaign was a defining moment for our
team. It not only showcased your expertise but also reaffirmed the critical
role Cryoworld plays in bringing our vision to life. As we approach the
pivotal phases of taxi and flight tests, your hands-on support and the
involvement of a dedicated technician will be invaluable in navigating the
complexities ahead.

The opportunity to work so closely with Cryoworld has been a unique and
inspiring experience for our students. Your willingness to share knowledge,
engage with our ideas, and provide constructive feedback has not only
shaped our engineering efforts but also left a lasting impact on the way we
approach innovation.

Next Steps

1. Improved Communication: We acknowledge past delays in communication and
are committed to maintaining clear channels moving forward. I want to
specify our contacts, as well as get an overview of what Cryoworld wants
and needs from the partnership; this will be written down for this yearâs
as well as upcoming yearâs teams.

â¢ Technical Contact: Davide Mangini <davide.mangini@aerodelft.nl>

â¢ Partnership Contact: Emil Lambert <emil.lambert@aerodelft.nl>

2. Technical Alignment: As Cryoworld is the leading company in cryogenics
we would like to collaborate on even more systems than just the hydrogen
tank. For this we could use your help for:

   -

   Distribution system: Distributing both the liquid and gaseous hydrogen
   to the heat exchanger and the fuel cell.
   -

   Component research: Your expertise and longevity in the market is
   essential to us for finding the right components.
   -

   Advanced Knowledge: As we aim to qualify our distribution system we need
   to think about all the possible edge cases we might encounter, and your
   experience in the sector will be essential for us.

3. Meeting Proposal: Letâs schedule a meeting by the end of January to
discuss the next steps. Here is a link <https://lettucemeet.com/l/ROB7X> so
we can find a suitable time, if none of these days work please let us know.
This will also be a good opportunity for AeroDelft to share what we want to
provide Cryoworld in our future collaboration, in terms of technical data,
exposure and recruitment.

Thank you for your continued support. Weâre excited about what lies ahead
and look forward to strengthening our collaboration. If you have any
questions or feedback, please donât hesitate to reach out.

Warm regards,

-- 

Emil Wes Lambert

Business Manager AeroDelft

emails.subject: DTB Meeting Notes
emails.body:
Hey Tamas,

Here is an overview of what happened at the last DTB meeting.

Notes:

   - Alexander and Hans come as one for DTB, it is best to message them
   both even if you need one.
   - Antonina wanted to confirm whether the compressor to get the hydrogen
   up to 700 bar needed to be ATEX certified or not.
   - They want us to share the timeline so we can coordinate better when to
   do the taxi test so that we don't slow down DTB / they don't slow us down.
   - Air Products need a one-month notice for delivery. They can do two
   weeks, but one month is safe / not rushed.
   - LVNL are slow, they take months, not weeks. Ideally a *triangle *of
   communication is set up with LVNL, DTB, and Air-side operations at RTHA.
   -

   For NLR pipistrel, they're quite flexible with where to do engine runup.
   No written protocol at RTHA for doing test runs.


AP: Send a reminder to Hans & Alexander for the meeting.
AP: Check whether ATEX certification is needed for the compressor.
AP: Share Internal Timeline.
AP: Check what we need with LVNL (air traffic control) in order to
arrange the taxi test, Alexander has good contacts and wants to help.

I'm happy to help btw, I don't want to pile this up on you. And I hope you
enjoyed China.

-- 

Emil Wes Lambert

Business Manager AeroDelft

emails.subject: AeroDelft 20 Hours Purchase Order
emails.body:
Dear Ingegerd & Karl,

Iâve attached the purchase order for the 20 engineering hours from Powercell. I would like to request a modification to the terms so that any additional hours are charged at the agreed-upon rate of 150 EUR/hour.

We greatly value our partnership with Powercell and have always appreciated the collaborative spirit of our work together. However, we were quite surprised by the recent developments. My understanding was that Powercell played a key role in assisting AeroDelft with the decision to proceed with a new pump and that Powercell were aware of this choice. We were not informed that this would entail covering significant additional costs.

This situation doesnât seem to align with the spirit of our agreement, particularly regarding the intern arrangement. The internship was established to cover the engineering hours AeroDelft would need, while also providing and incentivising Powercell with the benefits of productive working hours and the potential for future employment of the intern.

We believe in open communication and mutual support to make the most out of our collaboration. It seems there may have been some misalignment in expectations, which we hope to address. Moving forward, we feel itâs important to ensure that all terms are clearly defined to avoid any misalignment of expectations and to strengthen our partnership.

The way engineering hours have been handled both last year and this year has raised some concerns, and this will certainly influence the approach to the upcoming renegotiation of our contract. We are committed to finding a path that benefits both parties and upholds the cooperative relationship weâve built.

Lastly, we would greatly appreciate it if you could provide an overview of how the engineering hours from the previous purchase have been allocated.

Thank you for your attention to this matter. We look forward to resolving these issues amicably and continuing our successful collaboration.

Best regards,
ï¿¼


Emil Wes Lambert
Business Manager AeroDelft

emails.subject: AeroDelft Meeting Follow Up
emails.body:
Hi Gentia,

Thanks again for your time! I wanted to run a few things by you, here they are. Of course it is a lot of questions so Iâve labled the urgent questions.

HAPSS (Priority)
We want to run our Scope of Work for joining the HAPSS project by you. We have been told to make it as vague as possible so that we can be flexible with what costs and hours we charge to the subsidy. If we could get your thumbs up on it, or any changes youâd recommend it would be great. Iâve attached the Scope of Work as well as the Draft Deelprojectplan if you want/need the additional information.
We would be classified as a knowledge institute as apart of the subsidy, however we have concerns that we may not be able to be classified as one, or it will be pulled from us later on. We also have recieved conflicting information, Conscious Aerospace says that it is a contractural matter whether we are a knowledge institute and that the ministry has said we are a knowledge institute. Our platinum partners on the other hand, say that the KvK determines whether we are a knoweldge institute.
We had concerns related to IP, and liability. I wanted to confirm that our interpretation of this was correct. Iâve attached that too as HAPSS legal concerns.

Recruitment
(Priority) We wanted to see if it possible to recruit a minor. We have all members sign an NDA, media rights agreement and an intelectual property rights agreement. I worry specifically that having a minor sign an NDA even with it being cosigned by their parent/guardian will still leave a lot of legal grey area.
We wanted to see if it was worth implementing voulenteer contracts. Currently (if I understand correctly) management is practically the sole responsible people of AeroDelft as there is no official employment/volenteer contract. As we are getting quite large now and are working on a lot of testing, do you see value in us setting up an official voulenteer contract.

Motor Acquistion
We bought a motor back in October 2022 which was in the quote scheduled to arrive in October 2023. Since that date we have recieved the same story of the motor will take an addition 2-8 weeks. Altough progress is being made on the motor, we still do not have it and it becoming critical that we recieve it too otherwise it will hinder the entire project. The delays have led to us losing our entire testing budget through NLR for one year, and an additional 20k provided by Conscious. What steps would you recommend, even if we are to receive the motor without encouring project delays, we still have lost an entire years testing budget.

Looking forward to your response, if you need any elaboration please reach out anytime!

Many thanks,
ï¿¼ï¿¼ï¿¼ï¿¼ï¿¼
Emil Wes Lambert
Business Manager AeroDelft

emails.subject: AeroDelft Airbus Internships
emails.body:
Hello Bruno,

I hope you enjoyed our tour; it was a pleasure to show you around.

Currently, Iâm in touch with Eva about ways to expand the Airbus partnership. Each year, we at AeroDelft see a strong interest from AeroDelft alumni in applying for positions with Airbus ZEROe, so we thought formalising this connection could benefit both Airbus and AeroDelft; as well as expand the current partnership.

Our idea is to position an AeroDelft alumnus at Airbus each year as a full-time intern specifically within the ZEROe project, where most of our alumniâs interests lie. This arrangement would enable us to access approximately 100 engineering hours per year, allowing us to collaborate more closely with the ZEROe team and draw from their expertise. Over the past year, weâve aimed to deepen our technical collaboration with Airbus, but securing approval for dedicated hours has often been a challenge.

For Airbus, this setup would mean a steady pipeline of qualified interns each year. Additionally, AeroDelft can promote Airbus career opportunities, providing more direct access to students and strengthening the link between Airbus and future talent at the faculty.

Let me know if this is of interest and it would be great to know who to approach at ZEROe.

Best regards,

Emil Wes Lambert
Business Manager AeroDelft

emails.body:
Dear Daniel,

We met last year at the AeroDelft Lustrum, I was supposed to reach out for
the internship platform. This is still mostly word of mouth and is due for
a real structure, but I've had to sideline it for a while. I want to work
on it over the summer when I have some time.

The other reason I want to reach out is to see what potential
collaboration there is. We often get referred to contact DLR when looking

be able to expand the current network. Likewise, I feel DLR stands to gain

emails.subject: Update on AeroDelft testing
emails.body:
Dear Charlotte,

I apologise for the lack of communication on our side. We have been
experiencing delays to testing due to a missing component, however, we have
found a suitable alternative for testing and will begin testing at the
end of this week / the coming week.

We wanted to integrate the air products post with the successful testing of
our gaseous hydrogen testbed (we thought this would be a great occasion to
demonstrate the partnership).

With regards to the liquid hydrogen post, we faced similar delays. We had a
test campaign back in December but had issues with the vacuum of the
cryogenic tank. This has now been resolved and we are waiting for a testing
slot at our facilities. We are expecting to begin testing in 2-4 weeks.
This will also make a great post as this will be the first time any student
team works with liquid hydrogen.

If you have time, I'd be happy to set up a call and give a quick update on
the project. Just let me know a time, Tuesday-Thursday is when I am most
free.

I will update you when I know/have more information on the testing.

Best regards,
-- 

Emil Wes Lambert

Business Manager AeroDelft

E: emil.lambert@aerodelft.nl
